newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt says April crude output falls, natgas rises.
newsitem.headline: Egypt says April crude output falls, natgas rises.

text.p: Egyptian crude oil production went down again in April to an average of 838,666 barrels per day (bpd) from 845,161 bpd in March, the state's Egyptian General Petroleum Corp (EGPC) said on Tuesday.
But EGPC said natural gas output rose to 1.337 billion cubic feet a day from March's 1.306 billion cubic feet.
Condensates were higher again in April at 39,267 bpd from 38,064 bpd in March, while butane and propane output was marginally down at 31,500 from 31,935, EGPC said.
